title: How to Report Someone on Snapchat

steps.title: Open Snapchat on your phone or tablet .
steps.content: Open Snapchat on your phone or tablet . It's the yellow-and-white ghost icon on your home screen or in the app drawer.

steps.title: Open the Snap or Story you want to report.
steps.content: Open the Snap or Story you want to report. If someone sent you an offensive Snap, swipe left to the Chat screen and tap the message. If it's a story, swipe left to the Discover page, and then select the Story in question.

steps.title: Tap and hold the Snap or Story.
steps.content: Tap and hold the Snap or Story. Some icons will appear at the bottom.

steps.title: Tap the flag icon.
steps.content: Tap the flag icon. This opens the Report screen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the reason you're reporting this Snap or Story.
steps.content: Tap the reason you're reporting this Snap or Story. If you don't see something applicable, tap More options to see what else is there, or Other to enter your own reason.

steps.title: Describe why you're reporting this Snap or Story.
steps.content: Describe why you're reporting this Snap or Story. You can type up to 250 characters.

steps.title: Tap the Submit button.
steps.content: Tap the Submit button. This reports the issue to Snapchat's support team. If the Snap or Story violates Snapchat's terms of service, the Snapchat team will take appropriate action.

steps.title: Open Snapchat on your phone or tablet .
steps.content: Open Snapchat on your phone or tablet . It's the yellow-and-white ghost icon on your home screen or in the app drawer.

steps.title: Tap the profile photo of the person you want to report.
steps.content: Tap the profile photo of the person you want to report. You can do this in a Chat or by searching for the user on the Discover page. The photo is to the left of the person's name at the top of a Chat. This opens the user's profile. To search for a user, swipe left on the camera screen, tap the Search bar at the top, and then type the person's name or username. Tap the correct user's photo in the results to open their profile.

steps.title: Tap the menu ⋮.
steps.content: Tap the menu ⋮ . It's the three vertical dots at the top-right corner of the profile.

steps.title: Tap Report.
steps.content: Tap Report . It's at the top of the menu.

steps.title: Tap the reason you're reporting this user.
steps.content: Tap the reason you're reporting this user. If the account has been hacked, is impersonating someone, or is a Spam account, tap the appropriate answer. If you choose an option like They're annoying or Mean or inappropriate Snaps , you'll be told to block the person instead. To block someone, swipe right to the Chat screen, tap and hold the person you want to block, select More , and then tap Block .

steps.title: Describe why you're reporting this Snap or Story.
steps.content: Describe why you're reporting this Snap or Story. You can type up to 250 characters.

steps.title: Tap the Submit button.
steps.content: Tap the Submit button. This reports the account to Snapchat, who will investigate the issue and take appropriate action.

steps.title: Open Snapchat on your phone or tablet .
steps.content: Open Snapchat on your phone or tablet . It's the yellow-and-white ghost icon on your home screen or in the app drawer.

steps.title: Locate the Show you want to report.
steps.content: Locate the Show you want to report. If you found a Show that contains excessive violence, nudity, hate speech, or other offensive content, you can report it without having to watch it again. Just swipe left to the Discover page (or the Shows page, if you found it there) and scroll to the Show in question.

steps.title: Tap and hold the Show's tile.
steps.content: Tap and hold the Show's tile. You can lift your finger when the menu expands.

steps.title: Tap Report Tile.
steps.content: Tap Report Tile . It's the first option on the menu. A list of options will appear. If you just don't want to see the Show as a suggestion, you tap Hide this Content instead.

steps.title: Select a reason for reporting the Show.
steps.content: Select a reason for reporting the Show. If you don't see the correct reason, tap More options at the bottom to see some more, or tap Other to type your own.

steps.title: Describe why you're reporting this Show.
steps.content: Describe why you're reporting this Show. Summarize the problem with the Show in 250 characters or less. or Story.

steps.title: Tap the Submit button.
steps.content: Tap the Submit button. Snapchat's support team will review your complaint and take action if the show violates their policies.
